benchmark_details.name: BackdoorLLM
benchmark_details.overview: BackdoorLLM is the first comprehensive benchmark for studying backdoor attacks on Large Language Models (LLMs). It features a repository of backdoor benchmarks with a standardized training pipeline, diverse attack strategies, extensive evaluations, and insights into the effectiveness and limitations of backdoors in LLMs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized framework to study backdoor attacks on LLMs and raise awareness of related security threats.
tasks: Develop defense mechanisms against backdoor threats

data.source: Stanford Alpaca, AdvBench, math reasoning data, SST-2, AGNews

methodology.calculation: ASR is measured for both clean prompts and backdoored prompts.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ASR indicates a more effective backdoor attack.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments across 8 backdoor attacks on 7 scenarios and 6 model architectures.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential for generating harmful outputs based on backdoor triggers.
